Stewardson Brown  (April 29, 1867 â€“ March 14, 1921) was an American botanist who served as curator of the herbarium at the Philadelphia Academy of Natural Sciences. He collected plants in the New Jersey Pine Barrens, the Florida Keys, the Canadian Rockies, and Bermuda.
